document_data.name: Yi Niu
document_data.mainbody: '''Yi Niu''' was a [[ghost]]ly lieutenant who served [[Nan Kung Chi]] in the [[Crypt of Durkon]] in [[Kara-Tur]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Possessions: Even in her [[undead]] form, Yi Niu wore a simple [[helmet]] and a set of [[enchanted]] ''+1'' [[splint mail]] armor. She carried a magic ''+1'' [[composite longbow]] and kept ''[[arrows of biting]]'', ''[[acid arrow]]s'', and mundane [[arrow]]s in her quiver. In close combat, Yi Niu wielded a ''+1'' magical [[bastard sword]]. She wore a ''[[ring of duplication]]'' on a finger and had a ''[[potion of superior healing]]'', a ''[[potion of extra healing]]'', and a ''[[potion of invulnerability]]'' ready.
document_data.History: Yi Niu died many moons before the late 14{{th}} century DR. In life, she was a [[ranger]] and one of six trusted lieutenants who served Nan Kung Chi. She continued to do the same long after death. In the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, the crypt faced an [[illithid]] incursion led by [[Goxxa]] the [[alhoon]]. The mind flayers consumed ancient preserved minds of the crypt's dead and sought the ''[[Claw of the Black Leopard]]''. At the same time, a [[vampire]] [[thief]] named [[Hexxat]] arrived at the tomb on the behest of her master [[Larloch]], who sought the tomb's magical treasure. A ghostly [[monk]] named [[Ki Chin Sang]] stood guard of Nan Kung Chi's tomb and demanded anyone seeking entrance to defeat six of Nan Kung Chi's trusted undead lieutenants who all were interred together. When Hexxat and her allies challenged the lieutenants to battle, Yi Niu was joined by [[Weimin Min]], [[Borok-Tosst]], [[Ming-hua Dai]], and [[Jiang Dai]], and, presumably, was defeated.
